summary.span: 表示一个时间间隔。

span.span: Represents a time interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个对象都表示一个时间间隔 （持续时间的时间或时间），单位为正数或负数的天数、 小时、 分钟、 秒和小数部分的第二个数字。A object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. 结构还可以用于表示一天时间，但仅，如果与某一特定日期无关的时间。The structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date. 否则为或应改为使用结构。Otherwise, the or structure should be used instead. (有关使用详细信息结构，以反映一天的时间，请参阅[选择之间 DateTime、 DateTimeOffset、 TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。)(For more information about using the structure to reflect the time of day, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md).) > [!NOTE] > 一个值表示时间间隔，并且可以表示为特定数目的天数、 小时、 分钟、 秒和毫秒。A value represents a time interval and can be expressed as a particular number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. 因为它表示常规间隔，而无需引用特定的开始或结束点，则不能将其表示年和月，两者都具有可变数量的天方面。Because it represents a general interval without reference to a particular start or end point, it cannot be expressed in terms of years and months, both of which have a variable number of days. 它不同于值，该值表示日期和时间，而无需引用特定时区，或值，该值表示某个特定时刻的时间。It differs from a value, which represents a date and time without reference to a particular time zone, or a value, which represents a specific moment of time. 最大单元时间结构使用的度量持续时间为一天。The largest unit of time that the structure uses to measure duration is a day. 时间间隔是以天为保持一致性，计，这是因为天时间，如几个月和年，可查看大单位数而异。Time intervals are measured in days for consistency, because the number of days in larger units of time, such as months and years, varies. 值对象是等于所表示的时间间隔的计时周期数。The value of a object is the number of ticks that equal the represented time interval. 时钟周期等于 100 纳秒或秒的一千万分之一。A tick is equal to 100 nanoseconds, or one ten-millionth of a second. 值对象的范围可以从到。The value of a object can range from to . ## 实例化一个 TimeSpan 值Instantiating a TimeSpan Value 可以实例化中通过多种方式的值：You can instantiate a value in a number of ways: - 通过调用其隐式默认构造函数。By calling its implicit default constructor. 这将创建一个对象，其值为，如下面的示例所示。This creates an object whose value is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 通过调用其显式构造函数之一。By calling one of its explicit constructors. 下面的示例初始化为指定的小时、 分钟和秒数的值。The following example initializes a value to a specified number of hours, minutes, and seconds. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] - 通过调用方法或执行返回的操作值。By calling a method or performing an operation that returns a value. 例如，您可以实例化值，该值表示两个日期和时间值，如以下示例所示的时间间隔。For example, you can instantiate a value that represents the interval between two date and time values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] 此外可以初始化中这种方式，如以下示例所示的零个时间值的对象。You can also initialize a object to a zero time value in this way, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/zero1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/zero1.vb#6)] 算术运算符和方法的返回值， ，和结构。 values are returned by arithmetic operators and methods of the , , and structures. - 通过分析的字符串表示形式值。By parsing the string representation of a value. 可以使用并方法以将包含到的时间间隔的字符串转换值。You can use the and methods to convert strings that contain time intervals to values. 下面的示例使用方法将字符串转换为数组转换为值。The following example uses the method to convert an array of strings to values. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/cs/instantiate1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class/vb/instantiate1.vb#5)] 此外，可以定义要分析并转换为的输入字符串的确切格式值通过调用或方法。In addition, you can define the precise format of the input string to be parsed and converted to a value by calling the or method. ## 对 TimeSpan 值执行操作Performing Operations on TimeSpan Values 可以添加或减少持续时间是通过并运算符，或通过调用和方法。You can add and subtract time durations either by using the and operators, or by calling the and methods. 此外可以通过调用来比较两个持续时间， ，和方法。You can also compare two time durations by calling the , , and methods. 结构还包括和方法，将时间间隔转换为正值和负值，The structure also includes the and methods, which convert time intervals to positive and negative values, 范围值是到。The range of values is to . ## 设置一个 TimeSpan 值的格式Formatting a TimeSpan Value 一个的值可以表示为 [*-*]*d*。*hh*:*mm*:*ss*。*ff*，其中可选负号指示负时间间隔*d*分量表示天， *hh*表示小时采用 24 小时制， *mm*为分钟， *ss*为秒，和*ff*为秒小数部分的第二个。A value can be represented as [*-*]*d*.*hh*:*mm*:*ss*.*ff*, where the optional minus sign indicates a negative time interval, the *d* component is days, *hh* is hours as measured on a 24-hour clock, *mm* is minutes, *ss* is seconds, and *ff* is fractions of a second. 也就是说，时间间隔组成正值或负值数不包括一天中的时间的天或数天的时间为一天或仅一天的时间。That is, a time interval consists of a positive or negative number of days without a time of day, or a number of days with a time of day, or only a time of day. 开头[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，则结构支持区分区域性的格式通过重载其方法，它将转换为其字符串表示形式的值。Beginning with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the structure supports culture-sensitive formatting through the overloads of its method, which converts a value to its string representation. 默认值方法通过使用等同于它在以前版本的.NET Framework 的返回值的固定格式返回时间间隔。The default method returns a time interval by using an invariant format that is identical to its return value in previous versions of the .NET Framework. 重载允许您指定一个格式字符串，定义的时间间隔的字符串表示形式。The overload lets you specify a format string that defines the string representation of the time interval. 重载允许您指定一个格式字符串，其格式设置约定用于创建时间间隔的字符串表示形式的区域性。The overload lets you specify a format string and the culture whose formatting conventions are used to create the string representation of the time interval. 支持这两个标准和自定义格式字符串。 supports both standard and custom format strings. (有关详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。)但是，只有标准格式字符串是区分区域性的。(For more information, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md).) However, only standard format strings are culture-sensitive. ## 还原旧版 TimeSpan 格式设置Restoring Legacy TimeSpan Formatting 在某些情况下，代码中的成功格式中的值以[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]早期版本中的失败和[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]。In some cases, code that successfully formats values in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions fails in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. 这是在代码中调用的最常见[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)方法来设置格式有一个格式字符串的值。This is most common in code that calls a [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md) method to format a value with a format string. 下面的示例成功设置中的值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]及更早版本，但在引发异常[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]及更高版本。The following example successfully formats a value in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions, but throws an exception in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] and later versions. 请注意，它会尝试设置的格式通过使用不受支持的格式说明符，在将被忽略的值[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]及更早版本。Note that it attempts to format a value by using an unsupported format specifier, which is ignored in [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)] and earlier versions. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/cs/legacycode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.Legacy#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.legacy/vb/legacycode1.vb#1)] 如果您不能修改代码，则可以还原的旧格式中通过以下方式之一的值：If you cannot modify the code, you can restore the legacy formatting of values in one of the following ways: - 通过创建配置文件包含[< TimeSpan_LegacyFormatMode > 元素](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md)。By creating a configuration file that contains the [ element](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/timespan-legacyformatmode-element.md). 设置此元素的`enabled`归于`true`恢复旧基于每个应用程序格式设置。Setting this element's `enabled` attribute to `true` restores legacy formatting on a per-application basis. - 通过设置"NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode"兼容性切换时创建应用程序域。By setting the "NetFx40_TimeSpanLegacyFormatMode" compatibility switch when you create an application domain. 这将启用旧设置每个应用程序域基础上的格式。This enables legacy formatting on a per-application-domain basis. 下面的示例创建使用应用程序域旧格式设置。The following example creates an application domain that uses legacy formatting. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/perappdomain1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/perappdomain1.vb#1)] 下面的代码执行时在新的应用程序域中，它将恢复为旧格式设置行为。When the following code executes in the new application domain, it reverts to legacy formatting behavior. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/cs/showtimespan.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Class.AppDomain#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.class.appdomain/vb/showtimespan.vb#2)] ## Examples 下面的示例实例化对象，表示两个日期之间的差异。The following example instantiates a object that represents the difference between two dates. 然后，它显示对象的属性。It then displays the object's properties. remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`参数包含窗体中的时间间隔规范：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | [*d*。]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | [*d*.]*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个所选内容从列表中的可选项括在大括号 （{和}） 并由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|一个可选负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|分隔天与小时区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选秒数，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*.**.*|将秒与秒的小数部分分隔开一个区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分，包含 1 到 7 位小数。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 如果`s`参数不是日期值，它必须包括小时和分钟数部分; 其他组件是可选的。If the `s` argument is not a day value only, it must include an hours and a minutes component; other components are optional. 如果存在，每个时间组件的值必须位于指定范围内。If they are present, the values of each time component must fall within a specified range. 例如，值*hh*，小时数部分中，必须是介于 0 和 23 之间。For example, the value of *hh*, the hours component, must be between 0 and 23. 由于此，传递"23: 00:00"到方法将返回 23 个小时的时间间隔。Because of this, passing "23:00:00" to the method returns a time interval of 23 hours. 但是，传递"24: 00:00"返回的时间间隔为 24 天。On the other hand, passing "24:00:00" returns a time interval of 24 days. 因为"24"之外的小时数部分的范围，则将其解释为天数部分。Because "24" is outside the range of the hours component, it is interpreted as the days component. 组件`s`共同必须指定一个时间间隔，大于或等于且小于或等于。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法会尝试分析`s`使用上述每种特定于区域性的格式为当前区域性。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 时要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含多个七位数字，.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中的分析操作的行为可能不同的.NET Framework 4 和更高版本中执行分析操作。When a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may behave differently from parsing operations in the .NET Framework 4 and later versions. 在某些情况下，分析在.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中成功的操作可能失败并引发在.NET Framework 4 及更高版本。In some cases, parsing operations that succeed in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later. 在其他情况下，分析引发的操作版本中.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本可能会失败并引发在.NET Framework 4 及更高版本。In other cases, parsing operations that throw a in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later. 下面的示例说明了这两种方案。The following example illustrates both scenarios. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parsefailure1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换为字符串数组中的每个元素值。The following example uses the method to convert each element in a string array to a value. 它更改当前系统区域性为克罗地亚语-克罗地亚 ("hr-HR") 和英语-美国状态 ("EN-US")，以说明如何在当前系统区域性影响分析操作。It changes the current system culture to Croatian - Croatia ("hr-HR") and English - United States ("en-US") to illustrate how the current system culture affects the parsing operation. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/cs/parse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.Parse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.timespan.parse/vb/parse1.vb#1)]

span.span: The format of the string representation must match the specified format exactly.

returns.span: 与 对应的时间间隔，由 和 指定。

span.span: A time interval that corresponds to , as specified by and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，必须在所定义的格式的字符串表示形式`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 因为`input`的格式必须符合`format`确实如此，您应始终使用异常处理时将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔。Because `input` must conform to the format of `format` exactly, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果您不想使用异常处理，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `format`参数是一个包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的字符串`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`仅当`format`是一种标准设置其值为"g"或"G"的字符串的格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供格式返回字符串的特定于区域性的信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，它必须是所定义的格式之一的字符串表示形式`formats`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in one of the formats defined by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 因为`input`必须完全符合中指定的格式之一`formats`，将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must exactly conform to one of the formats specified in `formats`, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果您不想使用异常处理，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `formats`参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须精确对应于的成员`formats`的分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作将尝试匹配`input`中的所有元素`formats`从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`参数的格式字符串用于分析才`input`是一种标准设置其值为"g"或"G"的字符串的格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，如果用于分析的格式字符串提供格式返回字符串的区域性特定信息`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换为字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例解释使用法语-法国 ("FR-FR") 区域性的格式设置约定的字符串。The example interprets the strings using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规的长格式中的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，示例将更改时间间隔的分析方法在其中解释一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，一位数字被解释为时间间隔中天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 此更改生效，请注意`%h`自定义格式字符串中的其他格式字符串必须前面`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响分析中使用自定义格式字符串的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`存在一个负号时才被解释为一个负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为一个负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，则`format`必须包含文字的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. 它还使用要解释为一个负时间间隔的每个字符串值。It also uses the value to interpret each string as a negative time interval. 示例输出表明样式会影响返回值，仅当使用自定义格式字符串中使用时。The output from the example illustrates that the style affects the return value only when it is used with custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，它必须是所定义的格式之一的字符串表示形式`formats`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in one of the formats defined by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 因为`input`必须完全符合中指定的格式之一`formats`，将用户的字符串输入转换为时间间隔时，应始终使用异常处理。Because `input` must exactly conform to one of the formats specified in `formats`, you should always use exception handling when converting a string input by the user to a time interval. 如果您不想使用异常处理，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to use exception handling, you can call the method instead. `formats`参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须精确对应于的成员`formats`的分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作将尝试匹配`input`中的所有元素`formats`从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`参数的格式字符串用于分析才`input`是一种标准设置其值为"g"或"G"的字符串的格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，如果用于分析的格式字符串提供格式返回字符串的区域性特定信息`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响分析中使用自定义格式字符串的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`存在一个负号时才被解释为一个负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为一个负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，则`format`必须包含文字的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换为字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规的长格式中的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，示例将更改时间间隔的分析方法在其中解释一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，一位数字被解释为时间间隔中天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 此更改生效，请注意`%h`自定义格式字符串中的其他格式字符串必须前面`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意输出中的仅当使用此格式说明符分析字符串时使用的方法调用中指定的标志。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier. summary.span: 将当前 对象的值转换为其等效的字符串表示形式。

returns.span: 当前 值的字符串表示形式。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回的字符串"c"格式说明符进行格式设置，并采用以下格式：The returned string is formatted with the "c" format specifier and has the following format: [-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*][-][*d*.]*hh*:*mm*:*ss*[.*fffffff*] 元素在方括号 （[和]） 可能不包含在返回的字符串。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) may not be included in the returned string. 冒号和句点 (: and。) 是原义字符。Colons and periods (: and.) are literal characters. 下表中列出的非文本元素。The non-literal elements are listed in the following table. 请注意，返回的字符串方法不是区分区域性的。Note that the string returned by the method is not culture-sensitive. |项Item|描述Description| |----------|-----------------| |"-""-"|负号，指示负时间间隔。A minus sign, which indicates a negative time interval. 包含正时间跨度是没有登录。No sign is included for a positive time span.| |"*d*""*d*"|时间间隔中的天数。The number of days in the time interval. 如果对于一天的时间间隔，则忽略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval is less than one day.| |"*hh*""*hh*"|中从 0 到 23 之间的时间间隔的小时数。The number of hours in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 23.| |"*mm*""*mm*"|中的时间间隔，范围从 0 到 59 的分钟数。The number of minutes in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*ss*""*ss*"|中从 0 到 59 之间的时间间隔的秒数。The number of seconds in the time interval, ranging from 0 to 59.| |"*fffffff*""*fffffff*"|时间间隔中秒的小数部分。Fractional seconds in the time interval. 如果时间间隔不包含秒的小数部分，则忽略此元素。This element is omitted if the time interval does not include fractional seconds. 如果存在，则始终使用七个十进制数字表示秒的小数部分。If present, fractional seconds are always expressed using seven decimal digits.| > [!NOTE] > 有关比较的字符串表示形式和 Oracle 数据类型，请参阅知识库文章[324577： 为第二个数据类型的 system.timespan 值不会不匹配项是 Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146)。For more information about comparing the string representation of and Oracle data types, see Knowledge Base article [324577: System.TimeSpan Does Not Match Oracle 9i INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND Data Type](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=161146). ## Examples 下面的示例显示通过调用返回的字符串具有多种方法值。The following example displays the strings returned by calling the method with a number of values. 请注意，尽管该示例不会调用方法直接，它由调用方法时它会尝试转换为其字符串表示形式的值。Note that although the example does not call the method directly, it is called by the method when it attempts to convert a value to its string representation. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`参数可以是任何有效的标准或自定义格式说明符值。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard or custom format specifier for values. 如果`format`等同于是否`null`，当前的返回值常见格式说明符 ("c") 进行格式设置对象。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the common format specifier ("c"). 如果`format`为其他任何值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . 如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串，返回字符串的格式由当前区域性的格式设置约定定义。If `format` is a standard format string, the format of the returned string is defined by the formatting conventions of the current culture. > [!IMPORTANT] > 自定义格式字符串为值不包括日期或时间分隔符。The custom format strings for values do not include a date or time separator. 如果你想要包括这些元素在格式字符串中，您必须将它们视为字符文本。If you want to include these elements in your format string, you must treat them as character literals. 有关说明，示例，请参阅，请参阅[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)主题，了解详细信息。See the example for an illustration, and see the [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md) topic for more information. .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，其格式设置的以下主题中更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关详细信息的格式字符串值，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about format strings for values, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). - 有关对.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式设置类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用标准和自定义格式字符串显示在一个数组中的每个元素的字符串表示形式值The following example uses standard and custom format strings to display the string representation of each element in an array of values [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/cs/tostring3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.ToString/vb/tostring3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `s`参数包含窗体中的时间间隔规范：The `s` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | *d*。*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个所选内容从列表中的可选项括在大括号 （{和}） 并由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|一个可选负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|分隔天与小时区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选秒数，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|将秒与秒的小数部分分隔开一个区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分，包含 1 到 7 位小数。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 组件`s`共同必须指定一个时间间隔，大于或等于且小于或等于。The components of `s` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法会尝试分析`s`使用上述每种特定于区域性的格式为当前区域性。The method tries to parse `s` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the current culture. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 在某些情况下，如果要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含多个 7 位数字，分析在.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本中成功的操作可能失败并引发在.NET Framework 4 和更高版本。In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and throw an in the .NET Framework 4 and later versions. 下面的示例演示了此方案。The following example illustrates this scenario. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparsefailure1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来创建对象从有效字符串，还可以指示当失败分析操作，因为时间跨度字符串无效。The following example uses the method to create objects from valid strings and to indicate when the parse operation has failed because the time span string is invalid. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/TryParse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/TryParse1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `input`参数包含窗体中的时间间隔规范：The `input` parameter contains a time interval specification in the form: [*ws*] [-] { *d* | *d*。*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[。*ff*]]} [*ws*][*ws*][-]{ *d* | *d*.*hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] | *hh*:*mm*[:*ss*[.*ff*]] }[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 一个所选内容从列表中的可选项括在大括号 （{和}） 并由竖线分隔 (|) 是必需的。One selection from the list of alternatives enclosed in braces ({ and }) and separated by vertical bars (|) is required. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |-|一个可选负号，指示负。An optional minus sign, which indicates a negative .| |*d**d*|范围从 0 到 10675199 天。Days, ranging from 0 to 10675199.| |..|分隔天与小时区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates days from hours. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*hh**hh*|小时数，范围从 0 到 23。Hours, ranging from 0 to 23.| |::|区分区域性的时间分隔符符号。The culture-sensitive time separator symbol. 固定格式使用冒号 (":") 字符。The invariant format uses a colon (":") character.| |*mm**mm*|分钟数，范围从 0 到 59。Minutes, ranging from 0 to 59.| |*ss**ss*|可选秒数，范围从 0 到 59。Optional seconds, ranging from 0 to 59.| |..|将秒与秒的小数部分分隔开一个区分区域性的符号。A culture-sensitive symbol that separates seconds from fractions of a second. 固定格式使用句点 ("。") 字符。The invariant format uses a period (".") character.| |*ff**ff*|可选秒的小数部分，包含 1 到 7 位小数。Optional fractional seconds, consisting of one to seven decimal digits.| 组件`input`共同必须指定一个时间间隔，大于或等于且小于或等于。The components of `input` must collectively specify a time interval that is greater than or equal to and less than or equal to . 方法会尝试分析`input`使用上述每种特定于区域性的格式为指定的区域性`formatProvider`。The method tries to parse `input` by using each of the culture-specific formats for the culture specified by `formatProvider`. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供格式返回字符串的区域性特定信息。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## 调用方说明Notes to callers 在某些情况下，如果要分析的字符串中的时间间隔组件包含超过七位数字，分析操作的成功并返回版本中.NET Framework 3.5 及更早版本可能会失败并返回.net Framework 中4 和更高版本中，下面的示例演示了此方案。In some cases, when a time interval component in the string to be parsed contains more than seven digits, parsing operations that succeed and return in the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier versions may fail and return in the.NET Framework 4 and later versions, The following example illustrates this scenario. [!code-csharp[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/cs/tryparsefailure1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.TimeSpan.TryParse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.TimeSpan.TryParse/vb/tryparsefailure1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个数组对象，并对的调用中使用的每个对象方法来分析字符串数组中的元素。The following example defines an array of objects, and uses each object in calls to the method to parse the elements in a string array. 该示例阐释了特定区域性的约定如何影响格式设置操作。The example illustrates how the conventions of a specific culture influence the formatting operation. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，必须在所定义的格式的字符串表示形式`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法是类似于方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format`参数是一个包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的字符串`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`仅当`format`是一种标准设置其值为"g"或"G"的字符串的格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if `format` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供格式返回字符串的特定于区域性的信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，如果用于分析的格式字符串提供格式返回字符串的区域性特定信息`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换为字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 该示例通过使用法语-法国 ("FR-FR") 区域性的格式设置约定解释字符串。The example interprets the strings by using the formatting conventions of the French - France ("fr-FR") culture. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规的长格式中的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，示例将更改时间间隔的分析方法在其中解释一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，一位数字被解释为时间间隔中天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 此更改生效，请注意`%h`自定义格式字符串中的其他格式字符串必须前面`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，必须在所定义的格式的字符串表示形式`format`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法是类似于方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `format`参数是一个包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的字符串`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `formatProvider`参数是实现，提供格式返回字符串的特定于区域性的信息，如果`format`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if `format` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响分析中使用自定义格式字符串的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`存在一个负号时才被解释为一个负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为一个负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，则`format`必须包含文字的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的时间间隔使用各种格式字符串和区域性的多个字符串表示形式。The following example uses the method to parse several string representations of time intervals using various format strings and cultures. 它还使用要解释为一个负时间间隔的每个字符串值。It also uses the value to interpret each string as a negative time interval. 示例输出表明样式会影响返回值，仅当使用自定义格式字符串中使用时。The output from the example illustrates that the style affects the return value only when it is used with custom format strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析时间间隔，它必须是定义一个由指定的格式字符串的格式的字符串表示形式`formats`参数，只不过该前导和尾随空白字符将被忽略。The method parses the string representation of a time interval, which must be in the format defined by one of the format strings specified by the `formats` parameter, except that leading and trailing white-space characters are ignored. 此方法是类似于方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。This method is similar to the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. `formats`参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements consist of either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `input`. 有关有效的格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md)并[自定义 TimeSpan 格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md)。For more information about valid format strings, see [Standard TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-timespan-format-strings.md) and [Custom TimeSpan Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-timespan-format-strings.md). `input` 必须精确对应于的成员`formats`的分析操作成功。`input` must correspond exactly to a member of `formats` for the parse operation to succeed. 分析操作将尝试匹配`input`中的所有元素`formats`从数组中的第一个元素开始。The parse operation attempts to match `input` to each element in `formats` starting with the first element in the array. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法使用指定的区域性的约定`formatProvider`参数的格式字符串用于分析才`input`是一种标准设置其值为"g"或"G"的字符串的格式。The method uses the conventions of the culture specified by the `formatProvider` parameter only if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string whose value is either "g" or "G". "C"、"t"和"T"标准格式字符串使用固定区域性的格式设置约定。The "c", "t", and "T" standard format strings use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture. 自定义格式字符串定义精确的输入字符串格式，并使用原义字符分隔的时间间隔的组件。Custom format strings define the precise format of the input string and use literal characters to separate the components of a time interval. `formatProvider`参数是实现，如果用于分析的格式字符串提供格式返回字符串的区域性特定信息`input`是一个标准格式字符串。The `formatProvider` parameter is an implementation that provides culture-specific information about the format of the returned string if the format string used to parse `input` is a standard format string. `formatProvider`参数可以是任何以下：The `formatProvider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示在返回的字符串中反映其格式设置约定的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are to be reflected in the returned string. 返回对象属性定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个对象，用于定义返回的字符串的格式设置。A object that defines the formatting of the returned string. - 实现一个自定义对象接口。A custom object that implements the interface. 其方法将返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`formatProvider`是`null`，则使用当前区域性关联的对象。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object that is associated with the current culture is used. `styles`参数会影响分析中使用自定义格式字符串的字符串的解释。The `styles` parameter affects the interpretation of strings that are parsed using custom format strings. 它确定是否`input`存在一个负号时才被解释为一个负时间间隔 ()，或是否始终解释为一个负时间间隔 ()。It determines whether `input` is interpreted as a negative time interval only if a negative sign is present (), or whether it is always interpreted as a negative time interval (). 如果未使用，则`format`必须包含文字的负号符号 (如"\\-") 为成功分析负时间间隔。If is not used, `format` must include a literal negative sign symbol (such as "\\-") to successfully parse a negative time interval. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法将转换为字符串数组的每个元素值。The following example calls the method to convert each element of a string array to a value. 字符串可以表示常规短格式或常规的长格式中的时间间隔。The strings can represent a time interval in either the general short format or the general long format. 此外，示例将更改时间间隔的分析方法在其中解释一位数字的方式。In addition, the example changes the way in which the time interval parsing methods interpret a single digit. 通常，一位数字被解释为时间间隔中天数。Ordinarily, a single digit is interpreted as the number of days in a time interval. 相反，`%h`自定义格式字符串用于将单个数字解释为小时数。Instead, the `%h` custom format string is used to interpret a single digit as the number of hours. 此更改生效，请注意`%h`自定义格式字符串中的其他格式字符串必须前面`formats`数组。For this change to be effective, note that the `%h` custom format string must precede the other format strings in the `formats` array. 另请注意输出中的仅当使用此格式说明符分析字符串时使用的方法调用中指定的标志。Also note from the output that the flag specified in the method call is used only when parsing a string with this format specifier.
